title: [ICE]: fluent string: argument `lifetime_1` exists but was not referenced correctly

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
fn foo() -> impl Into<for<'a> fn(&'a ())> {
    (|_| {}) as for<'a> fn(_ )
}
```


### Affected release channels

- [ ] Previous Stable
- [ ] Current Stable
- [ ] Current Beta
- [X] Current Nightly

### Rust Version

```Shell
rustc 1.68.0-nightly (333ee6c46 2023-01-18)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 333ee6c466972185973d5097f8b5fb0f9fb13fa5
commit-date: 2023-01-18
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.68.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.6
```


### Current error output

_No response_

  |
3 | }
  |  ^ consider adding a `main` function to `ce07d43d0824ef1627fc3d0581e45b94bca99127.rs`
